skills: ['federal reserve system', 'federal reserve', 'reserve system', 'national incident response', 'incident response', 'intelligence', 'systems', 'computer', 'information systems', 'systems analysis', 'information', 'cyber', 'cyber threat', 'computer network', 'federal', 'reserve', 'security', 'response', 'national', 'national incident', 'cyber intelligence', 'threat']
title: Cybersecurity Analyst - Federal Reserve Bank System (National IT) - Henrico, VA
description:
About the Opportunity
The National Incident Response Team (NIRT), a national service provider for the Federal Reserve System, delivers effective and efficient national intrusion detection, incident response, security intelligence, threat assessment, and vulnerability assessment services for the Federal Reserve System. The mission of the National Incident Response Team is to play a leading role in the Federal Reserve System’s efforts to protect its information systems against unauthorized use.
NIRT is seeking a motivated intelligence or information security professional to serve as a Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) analyst to conduct analysis of classified information. This is an advisor-level role and will be responsible for providing peer leadership for a group of highly-skilled cyber professionals across intelligence, response, detection, and offensive security areas – all focused on defending the Federal Reserve System (FRS) from current and future cyber threats.
This analyst will operate from a secure facility and analyze significant current events, threat actors, campaigns, tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), and malware with the purpose of synthesizing classified and unclassified information, identifying patterns and understanding impact to current risk posture. This role will analyze both raw and finished classified national security reporting, with an emphasis on identifying reporting that may increase the cyber risk to the FRS. The candidate will also inform FRS information security and technology practitioners and managers, assess exposure, identify controls/mitigations, and provide situational awareness.
What You Will Do::
Develop and manage customer intelligence requirements; triage and evaluate classified reporting for relevance
Assist management in developing strategy and direction for the intelligence service; ensure execution
Leverage experience in the intelligence, cybersecurity, or information security domains to coach and mentor junior staff; generate effective and innovative solutions to support organizational change
Strong interpersonal and networking skills to connect with customers, partners, and peers
Translates knowledge of evolving threats into risk-based guidance to customers and stakeholders
Understands the cyber threat landscape for the financial services industry, central banks, and US government entities; contextualize broad changes in the cyber threat landscape for the business
Communicate cyber threat and risk information to business leaders; included delivering classified briefings and engagements w key bank stakeholders; contextualize reporting to risk decisioning
Review classified threat intelligence reporting; determine relevance for FRS and customers, evaluate content for future cybersecurity fusion center action (detect, respond, assess, emulate)
Optimize the cyber intelligence lifecycle; manage delivery of core intelligence services; develop cross-team initiatives to implement cybersecurity improvements for recognized gaps
Qualifications:
Clearance Required:
This role requires a TS-SCI DOD clearance. Therefore U.S. citizenship is required.
Education Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Cybersecurity, Systems Analysis, or a domain related field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Education Preferred:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Cybersecurity, Systems Analysis or a domain related field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Experience Required:
Typically requires 8+ years of combined intelligence, IT, and/or security work experience with a broad range of exposure to systems analysis, application development, systems administration and over 5 years’ experience in computer network defense, computer network exploitation, incident response, computer forensics, malware reversing, or cyber intelligence; experience in relevant computer network defense discipline.
Experience Preferred:
Typically requires 10-12+ years of combined intelligence, IT, and/or security work experience with a broad range of exposure to systems analysis, application development, systems administration and over 8 years in relevant computer network defense, computer network exploitation, incident response, computer forensics, malware reversing, cyber intelligence or engineering principles discipline
Other Requirements and Considerations:
A requirement of this position is that the employee must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19; individuals who are unable to be vaccinated due to a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief may request an accommodation from the Bank.
Candidates should review the Bank’s Employee Code of Conduct to ensure compliance with conflict of interest rules and personal investment restrictions.
Sponsorship is not available for this role. Selected candidate is subject to special background check procedures.
The selected candidate will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Eligibility for this specific position requires U.S. Citizenship.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $125,000.00 - $155,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)

title: Cybersecurity Analyst II (22-0427) - Office of the Attorney General of Texas - Austin, TX
description:
DIVISION: Child Support - Information Security 337
POSTING NUMBER: 22-0427
JOB TITLE: Cybersecurity Analyst II WORKING TITLE: Cybersecurity Analyst MONTHLY SALARY: $6,363.00
POSTING DATE: February 3, 2022 DURATION: Until Filled
LOCATION: 5500 E. Oltorf, Austin, TX 78741
GENERAL DESCRIPTION
Performs advanced (senior-level) cybersecurity analysis work for the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) Child Support(CS) Information Technology (IT) Division. Work involves protecting cybersecurity assets and delivering cybersecurity incident detection, incident response, threat assessment, cyber intelligence, software security, and vulnerability assessment services. OAG employees enjoy excellent benefits along with tremendous opportunities to do important work at a large, dynamic state agency making a positive difference in the lives of Texans.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Monitors and analyzes cybersecurity alerts from cybersecurity tools, network devices, and information systems. Monitors and maintains cybersecurity infrastructure and/or policies and procedures to protect information systems from unauthorized use. Performs vulnerability scans of networks and applications to assess effectiveness and identify weaknesses. Performs forensic analysis of information systems and portable devices, and forensic recovery of data using assessment tools.
Defines plans; organizes designs; and develops, modifies, tests, and integrates database or computer hardware systems to protect against cyber threats. Reviews, develops, and delivers cybersecurity awareness training. Researches and implements new security risk and mitigation strategies, tools, techniques, and solutions for the prevention, detection, containment, and correction of data security breaches.
Assists in advising management and users regarding security procedures. May occasionally manage multiple projects. May supervise the work of others.
Performs related work as assigned
Maintains relevant knowledge necessary to perform essential job functions
Attends work regularly in compliance with agreed-upon work schedule
Ensures security and confidentiality of sensitive and/or protected information Complies with all agency policies and procedures, including those pertaining to ethics and integrity
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education: Graduation from high school or equivalent
Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; experience in the following (or closely related) fields may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis: cybersecurity, information technology security, computer engineering, computer information systems, computer science, or management information systems
Experience: 7 years of full-time experience working in the following (or closely related) fields: cybersecurity, information technology security, computer engineering, computer information systems, computer science, or management information systems
Experience producing detailed intelligence analysis reports on cyber threats with the potential to impact the agency and present relevant findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Skill in developing and refining cyber threat intelligence collection and analysis processes, using technical and non-technical, internal and external (e.g., cyber defense vendor sites, US-CERT/CISA Directives, Computer Emergency Response Teams, Security Focus), threat intelligence sources.
Experience with Vulnerability Management Systems (e.g., Rapid7, Tenable/Nessus Scanning, Qualys).
Establish a vulnerability management program using systematic scanning, risk evaluation, and coordination to remediate or mitigate identified vulnerabilities. Experience with Endpoint Detection and Response (e.g. EndGame, Crowdstrike, CyberReason)
Experience with Email Threat Management (e.g. Proofpoint, MimeCast, Microsoft) Experience with SIEM engineering design/management/analysts (e.g. Splunk, Rapid7, SumoLogic)
Experience with Data Loss Protection/Cloud Access Security Brokers (e.g. Symantec, Microsoft, Bitglass, Netskope)
Experience with Cloud Enterprise Network Security (e.g. Cisco Umbrella, Palo Alto, ZScaler)
Knowledge of the limitations and capabilities of computer systems and technology; operational support of networks, operating systems, Internet technologies, databases, and security infrastructure; cybersecurity and information security controls, practices, procedures, and regulations; and incident response program practices and procedures
Skill in using application security standards, frameworks, attack methods, and mitigation best practices (e.g., OWASP, SANS, NIST, PCI DSS, HIPAA, CJIS, CIS Critical Controls)
Skill in the use of a computer and applicable software; and in the configuring, deploying, and monitoring security infrastructure
Skill in handling multiple tasks, prioritizing, and meeting deadlines
Skill in effective oral and written communication
Skill in exercising sound judgment and effective decision making
Ability to resolve complex security issues in diverse and decentralized environments; to plan, develop, monitor, and maintain cybersecurity and information technology security processes and controls; to communicate effectively; and to supervise the work of others
Ability to receive and respond positively to constructive feedback
Ability to work cooperatively with others in a professional office environment
Ability to provide excellent customer service
Ability to work in person at assigned OAG work location, perform all assigned tasks at designated OAG workspace within OAG work location, and perform in-person work with coworkers (e.g., collaborating, training, mentoring) as required.
Ability to work remotely as a manager-provided option, depending on work requirements and the needs of the OAG.
Ability to arrange for personal transportation for business-related travel
Ability to work more than 40 hours as needed and in compliance with the FLSA
Ability to lift and relocate 30 lbs.
Ability to travel (including overnight travel) up to 5%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Education: Master’s Degree
Education or certifications similar to the following: Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) GAIC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), GCFE Certified Forensic Examiner (GAIC ), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
Experience as a Splunk Enterprise Certified Architect, Splunk Enterprise Security Certified Admin, Splunk Phantom Certified Admin, or Splunk Cloud Certified Admin. Experience in performing Digital Forensics (i.e. by using the toolkit FTK / Autopsy etc.).
Skill and experience in determining tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for intrusion sets.
Skill in oral and written communication to convey complex and highly technical information to a diverse audience.
Ability to understand, follow, and convey complex oral and/or written instructions. Knowledge of applied “sound security” concepts, such as the principle of least privilege, the use of multi-factor authentication, and identity and access management. Knowledge of generally accepted information technology standards and practices; information technology practices; and information technology management practices Knowledge of Texas Child Support Program
Knowledge of Texas Child Support Enforcement System
TO APPLY
Applications for employment with the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) can be easily submitted through the OAG’s Job Postings Page (https://www.texasattorneygeneral.gov/careers/job-listings). The OAG also accepts applications submitted through www.WorkInTexas.com. Please note: A State of Texas application must be completed to be considered. Pursuant to the Texas Government Code, an applicant for any OAG position may be subject to a criminal background check. Military Crosswalk information can be accessed at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_InformationTechnology.pdf.
THE OAG IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $6,363.00 per month
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

title: Cybersecurity Intern - Summer 2023 - CBRE - Dallas, TX
description:
Cybersecurity Intern - Summer 2023

Job ID

87278

Posted

04-Oct-2022

Service line

Corporate Segment

Role type

Full-time

Areas of Interest

Digital & Technology/Information Technology, Interns/Graduate/Apprentice, Internship/Industry placement

Location(s)

Dallas - Texas - United States of America, Remote - US - Remote - US - United States of America, Richardson - Texas - United States of America

About CBRE’s Digital & Technology Organization:

The Digital & Technology (D&T) organization at CBRE is responsible for supporting and driving the world’s largest and most influential commercial real estate company into the future. This org alone is comprised of nearly 2,500 global employees (and counting) who build and deliver cutting-edge technology to our extensive list of Fortune 500 clients. Some of the brightest and most innovative product managers, UX/UI designers, software developers, cybersecurity professionals, and digital strategists in the industry make up this exciting and fast-paced group. Join us in Summer 2023!

Our global headquarters office is located in Richardson, Texas, just north of Dallas.

Digital & Technology Summer 2023 Internship Program - Overview:

CBRE is looking for Cybersecurity Internsto join our summer program in 2023.

We are also looking for top-notch Software Engineering, UX-UI Design, Data Science/Analytics, and Product Management Interns to join this program. If any of those sound like a better fit for you than Cybersecurity, please apply using the correct job application, which can be found here: https://www.cbre.com/careers/students-and-graduates/digital-and-technology-programs

**Please only apply to one intern position. All 5 intern positions are part of the same program. Applying to more than one will not increase your chances of being selected.**

If selected for this internship program, you will gain invaluable hands-on experience. You will learn from and be mentored by top tech professionals and contribute to technology that is utilized by over 105,000+ global CBRE employees and CBRE’s prominent clients.

Internship Program Highlights:

Start date: Late May 2023
End date: Early August 2023
Duration: 10 weeks
Hours/week: 40 hours (full-time)
Paid: Yes (hourly)
Location: Richardson, TX
You may request to work remotely, but it is not guaranteed.



Your responsibilities may include:

Scripting automation for cloud-based security systems
Role mining with Artificial Intelligence
Assisting in the development of web and mobile apps for public key infrastructure systems
Assisting in the set-up of federated trust relationships and single sign on systems
Developing cloud access management policies
Configuring chatbot based alerts for access policy violations
Developing metrics for Identity & Access Mgmt. systems leveraging ELK, Datadog, and Snowflake


What we’re looking for:

You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Cybersecurity (or related technical degree).
You are graduating sometime between Spring 2023 - Spring 2024.
In other words, you are a current junior or in undergrad or pursuing a graduate degree, with an expected graduation date of Spring 2024 or earlier.
You have a clear and demonstrated passion for cybersecurity.
You have a knack for problem-solving.
You are motivated and ambitious.
You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.


What we’re giving bonus points for:

You have previous internship and/or professional experience
You can quickly learn and apply different programming languages or technical concepts, as needed.
You are comfortable with public speaking and speaking during team meetings or other group settings .


Internship Perks:

Generous hourly pay
Fantastic foot in the door at a Fortune 126 company, with offices located all over the world.
Networking opportunities with CBRE executive leadership - including our company CEO!
Develop close relationships with your assigned mentor(s), manager, teammates, and fellow interns
Numerous intern events available throughout the summer:
Professional workshops & seminars
Technical trainings
Volunteer days
Office tours
Social/fun events
End of program off-site celebration event


If the above job description does not match the type of internship you are seeking for Summer 2023, please visit CBRE’s Students & Graduates careers website to learn about our other internship opportunities: https://www.cbre.com/careers/students-and-graduates

CBRE’s other technical internship opportunities are located here: https://www.cbre.com/careers/students-and-graduates/digital-and-technology-programs
**Please only apply to one Digital & Technology intern position. They are all part of the same internship program.**

#WayUp

CBRE is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter.

title: Data Engineer/Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst - Avantus Federal - Reston, VA
description:
Company Overview:
Avantus Federal, a NewSpring Holdings Company, is a mission-focused data, cyber and space services and solutions company. As a mid-market powerhouse with an intentional blend of elite talent, infrastructure and speed to impact, Avantus leads with technical and domain expertise for its Defense, Intelligence, Homeland Security and Federal Civilian customers.
Helping to solve some of the toughest national security problems and government missions, Avantus’ offerings enable services at scale, including: cyber technologies and operations, data and software solutions, digital engineering and integration, intelligence analysis and operations, transformation and advisory services and more.
Position Overview:
We have an opening for a Data Engineer/Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst to support our DTRA customer.
Responsibilities:
As an Asymmetric Threat Statistical Analyst, you will
Provide analytical support to our government client and forward deployed units
Counter improvised threats and the networks that finance, build, or employ such threats
Provide large-scale advanced analytics support; collecting, parsing, transforming, and integrating relevant data in support of projects; and providing operational, systems, and intelligence analysis to support the mission.
Provide data supporting strategic and operational requests from deployed and deploying units. These data sets may be used to: assist decision makers with risk assessments, prioritization, and/or to provide leadership with quantitative organizational assessments to support functional evaluations.
Develop, document, implement, and automate ETL (extract transform load) processes using SQL® and other analytical programming tools that most efficiently import structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from new and/or dynamic data sources, ensuring data validity, reliability, and availability to users.
Collaborate with team members to ensure retrieval of information pertinent to current work and timely dissemination of counter asymmetric threat products.
Required Qualifications:
Current Top Secret/Specialized Compartmented Information Security Clearance #AvantusClearedJob
Master's in a technical discipline plus three (3) years of experience; or Bachelor's in a technical field plus five (5) years of experience.
Significant programming experience in SQL® (including VBA, and macro).
Significant experience programming in at least one other programming language (Python, R, Perl, C++)
Effectively communicate both orally and in writing.
Successful Completion of Pre-Employment Background Investigation required
The status of applicable COVID-19 vaccination requirements under Executive Order 14042 are subject to change depending on applicable court orders and the course of ongoing litigation. Candidates may be required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or have an approved exemption
Preferred Qualifications:
SQL Certified Programmer certificate prior to employment.
Degree in one of the following disciplines: Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.
Experience using Python libraries including pandas, scipy, numpy, matplotlib, requests, or similar libraries in another programming language.
Knowledge of how to utilize business intelligence tools and processes that improve readability of and access to data, through the creation of stored/scheduled processes and effective visualization.
Ability to create complex programs that ingest, parse, clean, transform, and analyze large (millions of records) datasets; to apply mathematical and statistical models to real-world data, and; to deliver analytical results through written and oral presentations.
Prior experience utilizing ETL software (e.g., PowerCenter, Pentaho, PLSQL), Business Intelligence software (e.g., SAS® BI, Oracle BI, Cognos, Business Objects), or Geospatial Information Systems (GIS) software (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS® suite) is preferred.
Experience interacting with “big data” systems such as Hadoop or Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Experience using Alteryx Designer to build/manage workflows.
Prior experience as an all-source intelligence analyst or ORSA
Prior experience with Counter UAS operations.
Company EEO Statement:
Avantus Federal is an equal opportunity employer and Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) federal contractor. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other category protected by law. Avantus hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled.

title: District IT Analyst - Virginia Dept of Health - Winchester, VA
description:
Provides applications and technical support that is out -of -scope and not provided by OIM and VITA/NG in the health district. Serves as the district point of contact with OIM and VITA/NG. Supports the following applications: WebVision, WICNet, VENIS, F&A, etc. Provides user training as necessary. May serve as District Information Security Officer. Conducts inventory of technology equipment and supports equipment deemed out of scope of VITA/NG to include audio visual, telecommunications, and standalone printers. Works with the internet website. Provides data analytics, reporting, GIS coding and mapping as well as development of internal databases and spreadsheets using tools such as Excel, Access, etc. May utilize the OIM Data Warehouse.
Minimum Qualifications
Ability to communicate and work effectively with a diverse staff to implement change; work independently, with minimal supervision, to follow through on assignments and responsibilities.
A valid State Driver’s License is required to operate a state vehicle or if operating a personal vehicle while conducting business on behalf of the agency
Knowledge in information systems management and strong understanding of network topology with an emphasis on SQL report writing tools, data security and user access controls
Understanding of MS Office Suites including MS Access databases; strong understanding of Microsoft operating systems and client/server architecture to support agency application troubleshooting techniques, ability to use GIS software for data mapping; ability to understand network techniques and telecommunications systems to support application data sharing internally and externally with state and local government contacts; ability to coordinate and implement new data collection techniques; ability to install and support local agency software and printers that are out of scope to VITA; provide webmaster and system analysis support; ability to work with and train end users in agency applications; ability to analyze district’s existing service delivery system and evaluate impacts of new information system technology.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT/Networking, or Data Management, and/or equivalent combination of education and work experience in information system management
Knowledge of public and/or business administration, statistics, and research methodology and processes relating to information technology
Work experience in a health care setting with multi-disciplinary staff
Special Requirements
Employment is contingent upon satisfactory results of a state and federal criminal history background check and the Department of Social Service’s Child Abuse and Neglect Central Registry check, U.S. HHS IG Exclusion List check, employment reference check and E-Verify. Other financial, credit, driving, or other background checks prior to employment may be required for certain positions. Completion of Statement of Economic Interests will be required upon employment.
Special Instructions to Applicants
VDH accepts only online applications. Faxed, mailed, or emailed applications will not be considered. Applications are accepted until 11:59 pm on the job closing date.
VDH employees have shared code of ethics, which can be found in the bottom banner of our website at www.vdh.virginia.gov. As a V3 organization, VDH honors the commonwealth veterans hiring preference. VDH employees have a shared Code of Ethics, which can be found in the bottom banner of our website: www.vdh.virginia.gov.
State agencies must provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, should follow the instructions in the job opportunity announcement. For any part of the remaining hiring process, applicants should contact the hiring agency directly. Determinations on request for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.

title: Endpoint Management Analyst - University of North Carolina Asheville - Asheville, NC
description:
Endpoint Management Analyst
Located in the Blue Ridge Mountains in Western North Carolina, UNC Asheville is the designated public liberal arts campus in the University of North Carolina system. UNC Asheville is nationally known for the quality of our student-centered teaching, mentoring of undergraduates in research, interdisciplinary learning, and striving to be an inclusive campus community.
UNC Asheville’s commitment to increasing and sustaining the diversity of our faculty, staff, and students is reflected in our strategic plan goals of diversity and inclusion, and social sustainability. Women, traditionally under-represented minorities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

During this time it is important that the community understand how UNC Asheville operates and what is expected of community members as we work together to prioritize everyone’s health and safety. Please see UNC Asheville’s Community Expectations for more information. This is the URL for UNC Asheville's Community Expectations: UNC Asheville's Community Expectations.

Applications must be submitted online no later than 11:59 p.m. (EST) on the closing date for each specific position. Please note that any documents submitted to Human Resources or the hiring departments become property of UNC Asheville and will not be returned. Official verification from each college/university you have attended are required upon employment, and will be requested directly from the college/university by Human Resources or from the National Student Clearinghouse. Any expense will be the responsibility of the employee. Educational degrees must be from an appropriately accredited institution. If no applicants apply who meet the required competency and training and experience requirements, management may consider other applicants. Position Summary
This position acts as the primary administrator for endpoint management systems used to maintain UNC Asheville’s fleet of Microsoft, Apple, and Chrome devices. Endpoint management systems include Microsoft SCCM / MECM, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Autopilot, Jamf Pro, Google Chrome Management and other supported systems.
This position also provides technical support, consultation, and training to the UNC Asheville campus community across a variety of technologies. Typical areas of support include client hardware, operating systems, applications, printers, and networking. Examples of technologies supported on the UNC Asheville campus include Windows PCs, Macs, Android and iOS tablets and mobile devices, Google Apps, Moodle, and other supported systems.
Support is offered via the ITS Help Desk, phone, email, chat, remote control, and on-site. This position also plays a role in the annual Client Technology Refresh Program which annually replaces ~25% of the 1600 computers across campus.
Supported clients include UNC Asheville students, faculty, staff, volunteers, and visitors with a wide range of technical knowledge and skill levels. This position is highly visible and active on campus and often serves as the first point of contact for the campus community into the IT group, therefore excellent customer service and communications skills are very important.

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, math or engineering or related technical degree from an appropriately accredited institution; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Journey level requires an additional one year of experience.
Advanced level requires an additional two years of experience.
Preferred Education/Experience/Skills

The ideal candidate will have current technical knowledge of common hardware, mobile devices, operating systems, applications, and networking technologies. Strong analytical/troubleshooting skills and ability to work well with users of varying skill levels is strongly preferred. Various technical certifications may be applicable.

Typical hours are Monday – Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., occasional overtime as needed to meet the needs of the department and University.

Job Summary
The Information Technology Endpoint Support Specialist is a professional position responsible for supporting technologies and related services for Business & Finance at Auburn University. The Specialist is a member of the Information Systems Support Help Desk team and reports to a supervisor within ISS. This position will provide support with attention on PC software, hardware, and peripherals; University-wide information systems (ex., Banner, Kronos, Xtender); and internal ISS applications (ex., ticket and asset tracking).
At Auburn, our work changes lives. Learn more about Auburn’s impact, as well as generous employee benefits and opportunities by visiting aub.ie/working-at-auburn.
Auburn residents overwhelmingly rate the city as a great place to live, work and raise children, but don’t just take their word for it. Forbes has consistently ranked Auburn on its list of Best Places to Retire and Best Small Places for Business and Careers. Auburn City Schools has consistently been ranked among the top public school systems in the state and nation.
Auburn University is committed to providing a comprehensive employee benefits package that attracts and retains talent to further the University’s mission and contributes to the personal and financial well-being of employees and their families. Employee Benefits include: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Care, Cancer Insurance, Life Insurance/Personal Accident Coverage, Disability Group & Supplemental Plans, Flexible Spending Account Plan, and Mandatory and Voluntary Retirement Plans 403(b) with University match and 457(b), Auburn University Federal Credit Union, Bookstore discounts, Tiger Perks discounts on dining, shopping and entertainment, Travel Assistance (Domestic and International), and Educational Improvements for Employees and Dependents. Additional Employee Benefit details are available at: http://www.auburn.edu/administration/business-finance/benefits/index.html
Formal AU title: Specialist, Information Technology (
III
/IV)
Essential Functions
Essential functions include, but are not limited to:
Troubleshoots software and hardware; software installations and upgrades; configures new PCs and peripherals; monitors all aspects of the ISS Help Desk Ticketing System; prepares and maintains documentation for other frequently performed tasks and procedures; writes scripts, etc. where possible to automate basic tasks; assists with monitoring and remediation of sensitive data, backup tasks, and other maintenance systems in use by ISS.
The work of the Endpoint Support Specialist will vary depending on the needs of the organization and the competencies of the individual and will range from providing assistance and/or providing Tier I support to leading projects and/or providing high-level technical expertise on highly complex matters. The work of an Endpoint Support Specialist will also range from generalist work to in-depth support for a more narrowly defined field. Provides implementation, maintenance, system administration and support of hardware, software. Provides end-user support on information technology issues through consultation and advising, problem identification and resolution, training and preparation/maintenance of documentation. Participates in projects and cross-functional activities related to information technology initiatives or processes.
May be responsible for training, assisting or assigning tasks to others. May provide input to performance reviews of other employees.
Minimum Education and Experience
Education Level

Field of Study

End-user desktop support; systems analysis and programming in a business or university setting. Starting salaries for Level III are typically between $42K and $53K.

Level IV requires a high school diploma or equivalent and 5 or more years of relevant experience as listed above. Starting salaries for Level IV are typically between $53K and $65K.

Strong interpersonal skills with the proven ability to build and maintain relationships with project teams, vendors, constituents campus-wide, etc.
Excellent communication skills including the ability to articulate technical concepts effectively to non-technical users.

The successful candidate will be service-oriented and exhibit a professional demeanor. Candidates must be skilled at organizing, prioritizing, and managing multiple concurrent tasks.

title: ENGINEER/SCIENTIST 1
description:
Duties
You will provide expertise in research or development of new or improved systems or equipment, advancement of technology, or resolution of controversial or novel problems.
You will develop or test new equipment/materials/concepts that significantly add to the operability and usefulness of what exists or develops new equipment/systems having new features.
You will provide technical leadership to a group of engineers, scientists and technical support staff, responsible for a small to medium projects/programs.
You will develop plans and procedures to extend existing knowledge and tests to account for newly emerging ideas and concepts.
You will provide expert advice and guidance to managers, supervisors, peers, and sponsors on specific technical aspects of systems or concept development. In addition to meeting the basic entry qualification requirements, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the ND-03 (GS-9/11 equivalent) grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: As a professional engineer or scientist work on varied, complex state-of-the-art equipment systems, combat subsystems, and/or unique equipment systems and subsystems requiring the application of advanced scientific and engineering theories, concepts, and principles.

In addition to meeting the basic entry qualification requirements, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the ND-02 (GS-5/8 equivalent) grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: As a professional engineer or scientist applying engineering, computer, mathematical, or scientific principles to research, analyze, and interpret routine technical or scientific tasks in order to support other engineers or scientists.

skills: ['federal reserve', 'federal reserve banks', 'federal reserve system', 'security', 'richmond', 'federal', 'reserve', 'reserve banks', 'information security', 'information', 'grc information system', 'richmond fed', 'join federal reserve', 'information systems', 'continuous', 'cloud information security', 'cloud', 'management', 'national', 'risk management', 'cloud security', 'system', 'continuous monitoring']
title: Experienced Information Security Analyst - Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond - Richmond, VA
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond
The Richmond Fed is the proud home of the Federal Reserve’s National IT organization—a nationwide team delivering technology solutions and support across the Federal Reserve System. Many National IT employees are located in Richmond, while others are based across the U.S. at other Federal locations.
When you join our team, you’ll become part of a culture that welcomes differences, cares about our communities, and empowers each other to lead from where we are to make things better. Bring your passion and we’ll provide challenging and purposeful careers in a variety of fields, opportunities to grow and a wide range of benefits and perks that support your health and wealth. It’s all part of what makes #MyRichmondFed a great place to work!
About the Opportunity
The Experienced IS Analyst is a technical position that will support the migration of the organizations’ GRC information system of record. This position will also help the team enhance, automate and maintain second line of defense continuous monitoring and continuous authorization security practices.
What You Will Do:
Assist in the design, code, test, debug, and document security automation features across complex cybersecurity and cloud systems for the organization’s new GRC system of record.
Participate in the design and release management of process improvements for continuous monitoring and continuous authorization secure information systems.
Analyze and recommend improvements to potential security design challenges.
Recommend solutions to minimize and/or prevent system interruption.
Follow and ensure adherence to secure technical standards for programming and design techniques, and train other technical staff on use of software tools in accordance with required standards and procedures.
Help improve operational resiliency and efficiency through automation.
Be self-organizing and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams leveraging agile development practices.
Responsible for understanding and applying risk management discipline in decision making and contributing to their function`s risk management practices.
Qualifications:
Capabilities & Behaviors:
Strong analytical ability, attention to detail, and focus on data integrity and accuracy.
Proven track record to contribute on the development of procedures, process and gap analyses for continuous monitoring/continuous authorization information security practices and managing GRC software and related technology.
Strong communication skills with the ability to align the organization on complex technical and security risk decisions.
Contributes to and participates in process improvement and solution discussions and communicates outcomes tailored to audience needs (may include written, verbal and visual methods).
Ability to use data visualization to create ad hoc reports to combine both quantitative and qualitative information, developing key process indicators and performance reporting.
Demonstrated ability to participate in cross-functional project teams.
Proven ability to maintain a working knowledge of cloud information security and technology concepts, FedRAMP industry practices, and agile product management disciplines.
Expertise & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
2-3 years of information security experience.
Familiarity with cloud security and security policy concepts like FedRAMP, NIST Risk Management Framework, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and shared responsibility model.
1+ years of relevant experience, including hands-on experience with public, private or hybrid cloud services (Microsoft Azure, AWS, etc.) desirable.
Certification in one or more IS industry recognized certifications (such as CISSP, CISA/CISM, GIAC, or CRISC, etc.) is preferred.
Experience working on projects that span multiple organizations and business units
Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) or AWS Cloud certification desirable.
Experience with infrastructure as code tools (general programming languages) desirable.
Familiarity with product management and agile methodology desirable.
Discover the Reason Why So Many People Love It Here!
When you join Federal Reserve’s National IT organization, not only will you find a challenging and purposeful career, you’ll also have access to a wide range of benefits and perks that support your health and wealth, including:
Great medical benefits
Pension and 401(k) with employer match
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
Employee resource networks
Paid volunteer leave
Flexible work options
Onsite amenities that make working here fun
Other Requirements and Considerations:
A requirement of this position is that the employee must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19; individuals who are unable to be vaccinated due to a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief may request an accommodation from the Bank.
Candidates should review the Bank’s Employee Code of Conduct to ensure compliance with conflict of interest rules and personal investment restrictions.
Sponsorship is not available for this role. Selected candidate is subject to special background check procedures.
The selected candidate will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility for this specific position requires U.S. Citizenship.
The Richmond, VA hiring range(s): Experienced IS Analyst- $79,400 - $93,300 annually.
Salary offered will be based on the job responsibilities and the individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience as defined in the job qualifications/experience. For candidates not located in Richmond, VA, the salary range may be adjusted for your geographic location.
Full Time / Part Time
Full time
Regular / Temporary
Regular
Job Exempt (Yes / No)
Yes
Job Category
Analytical
Work Shift
First (United States of America)

The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences.

title: Forensic Analyst SME (Network Based) - Avantus Federal - Arlington, VA
description:
Company Overview:
Avantus Federal, a NewSpring Holdings Company, is a mission-focused data, cyber and space services and solutions company. As a mid-market powerhouse with an intentional blend of elite talent, infrastructure and speed to impact, Avantus leads with technical and domain expertise for its Defense, Intelligence, Homeland Security and Federal Civilian customers.
Helping to solve some of the toughest national security problems and government missions, Avantus’ offerings enable services at scale, including: cyber technologies and operations, data and software solutions, digital engineering and integration, intelligence analysis and operations, transformation and advisory services and more.
Position Overview:
Avantus Federal is seeking Network-based Systems Analyst IV to support a DHS customer.
Responsibilities:
Characterize and analyze network traffic to identify anomalous activity and potential threats to network resources
Coordinate with enterprise-wide cyber defense staff to validate network alerts
Document and escalate incidents (including event's history, status, and potential impact for further action) that may cause ongoing and immediate impact to the environment
Perform cyber defense trend analysis and reporting
Perform event correlation using information gathered from a variety of sources within the enterprise to gain situational awareness and determine the effectiveness of an observed attack
Provide daily summary reports of network events and activity relevant to cyber defense practices
Receive and analyze network alerts from various sources within the enterprise and determine possible causes of alerts
Provide timely detection, identification, and alerting of possible attacks/intrusions, anomalous activities, and misuse activities and distinguish these incidents and events from benign activities
Use cyber defense tools for continual monitoring and analysis of system activity to identify malicious activity
Analyze identified malicious activity to determine weaknesses exploited, exploitation methods, effects on system and information
Determine tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) for intrusion sets
Examine network topologies to understand data flows through the network
Identify and analyze anomalies in network traffic using metadata
Conduct research, analysis, and correlation across a wide variety of all source data sets (indications and warnings)
Validate intrusion detection system (IDS) alerts against network traffic using packet analysis tools
Identify applications and operating systems of a network device based on network traffic
Reconstruct a malicious attack or activity based off network traffic
Identify network mapping and operating system (OS) fingerprinting activities
Assist in the construction of signatures which can be implemented on cyber defense network tools in response to new or observed threats within the network environment or enclave
Notify designated managers, cyber incident responders, and cybersecurity service provider team members of suspected cyber incidents and articulate the event's history, status, and potential impact for further action in accordance with the organization's cyber incident response plan
Approximately 25% of the Consultant’s time will be spent executing the following tasks:
Prepare and update manuals, instructions, and operating procedures
Evaluate established methods & procedures and prepare recommendations for changes in methods and practices where appropriate
Plan and carry out difficult and complex assignments and develop new methods, approaches, and procedures
Conduct analyses and recommend resolution of complex issues affecting the specialty area
Ensure optimal use of commercially available products
Prepare and present reports
Evaluate the effectiveness of installed systems and services
Required Qualifications:
Active TS/SCI clearance
Ability to obtain Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Entry on Duty (EOD) Suitability
8+ years of direct relevant experience in cyber defense analysis using leading edge technologies and industry standard cyber defense tools- Experience successfully developing and deploying signatures
Experience detecting host and network-based intrusions via intrusion detection technologies (e.g., Snort)
Experience implementing incident handling methodologies
Experience implementing protocol analyzers
Experience collecting data from a variety of cyber defense resources
Experience reading and interpreting signatures (e.g., Snort)
Experience performing packet-level analysis
Experience conducting trend analysis
Operational experience with Splunk
The status of applicable COVID-19 vaccination requirements under Executive Order 14042 are subject to change depending on applicable court orders and the course of ongoing litigation. Candidates may be required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or have an approved exemption
Company EEO Statement:
Avantus Federal is an equal opportunity employer and Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) federal contractor. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other category protected by law. Avantus hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled.

title: IAM Analyst (Identity and Access Management Analyst) - Towson University - Towson, MD
description:
IAM Analyst (Identity and Access Management Analyst)
-
(
2200005K
)
Job Summary
Towson University (TU) is one of the nation’s top 100 public universities. Located north of Baltimore, TU currently enrolls over 22,000 students and is the second-largest university in the prestigious University System of Maryland. Towson University values diversity and fosters a climate that is grounded in respect and inclusion to cultivate the intellectual and personal growth of the entire university community.
The Identity and Access Management (IAM) Analyst is primarily responsible for the administration of the IAM system, Fischer Identity. The individual will provide support and growth of the platform to meet the university's business needs. This person will collaborate with technical staff, management, and business users to ensure the platform is used in an automated, sustainable, and secure manner.
Responsibilities and Duties
Provide support of existing components and workflows, analysis of business needs and incorporation into the platform, the creation and maintenance of documentation, and involvement in the continued growth of the IAM system.
Perform ticket management and participate in projects.
Report to the Manager of Identity and Access Management as part of the larger IAM group.
Collaboration and coordination within the IAM team, with other groups in the Office of Technology Services (OTS), and with technology and business users throughout the university.
Interacting with engineers and analysts to become familiar with the current university IAM processes and integrations with other systems.
Develop documentation of the current and future state of IAM at Towson University (TU).
Work closely with business users and engineers to gather requirements and translate them into rules and workflows in the IAM system. The IAM Analyst is expected to become familiar with the many account and access related rules and workflows for the university’s core systems.
Ensure that procedures and documentation are clear and concise; will stay informed of best practices and industry standards for IAM; will help ensure that all state, university, and audit security requirements are met; and will help the IAM team continue to evolve its knowledge and operations.
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor's degree required plus 2 years of work experience. Equivalent years of work experience may be substituted for the education requirement on a year-for-year basis with 30 college credits being equivalent to one year of experience.
Knowledge or experience with an Identity and Access Management (IAM) solution, whether a dedicated IAM system, or solutions (s) which provide automated management of accounts and access across multiple enterprise applications
Ability to understand existing account and access related processes, and adapt them to new IAM solutions
Ability to effectively communicate with management and colleagues, make technical presentations, perform cross-training, create meaningful reports, and inform management of issues or recommendations
Ability to manage multiple tasks to assure that they are delivered on-time, on budget, and meets customer requirements
Demonstrated ability to successfully interact with colleagues and stakeholders to understand requirements; thrives on collaboration and group design efforts
Ability to write technical documentation
Organized and detail-oriented
Excellent interpersonal skills
Preferred qualifications:
Knowledge and/or experience with an IAM/Identity Management system
Knowledge and/or experience with the Fischer Identity IAM platform specifically
Knowledge and/or experience with IAM standards, terminology, and best practices
Knowledge and/or experience with Active Directory or LDAP
Knowledge and/or experience with designing or maintaining permission and roles for large enterprise applications (such as an ERP, Human Resource system, or CRM)
Knowledge and/or experience with performing audits and access reviews
Knowledge and/or experience with SQL and/or scripting/development
Salary and Benefits
Competitive salary and full University benefits that include 22 days of annual leave, up to 14 holidays, personal and sick days; excellent health, life, and retirement plans; and tuition remission.

title: Identity & Access Management Analyst - Navy Federal Credit Union - Vienna, VA
description:
YOUR LIFE'S MISSION: POSSIBLE
You have goals, dreams, hobbies and things you’re passionate about.
What’s Important to You Is Important to Us
We’re looking for people who not only want to do meaningful, challenging work, keep their skills sharp and move ahead, but who also take time for the things that matter to them—friends, family and passions. And we're looking for team members who are passionate about our mission—making a difference in military members' and their families' lives. Together, we can make it happen.
Don’t take our word for it.
FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For®
Computerworld® Best Places to Work in IT
FORTUNE® Best Workplaces for Millennials
Forbes® America’s Best Employers
IND123
Basic Purpose
Serves as a lead level IAM Portfolio Analyst. Compiles, researches, analyzes, and documents data, requirements, workflow/ processes, functionality and/or controls related to Identity & Access Management. Develops and evaluates information, and prepares recommendations based on analysis for use in decision-making. Applies extensive and diversified knowledge of principles and practices in broad areas of assignments and relates fields. Works on the most complex, high impact projects. Provides leadership for IAM strategic transformational and compliance projects or programs. Serves as a technical specialist or advisor to the IAM transformation and compliance team. Acts as a liaison or subject matter expert to business and technical stakeholders transitioning to new IAM transformation and compliances processes.
Responsibilities
Provides complex analytical leadership across business stakeholders, technical stakeholders and other analysts supporting significant transformational and operational initiatives for the Identity & Access Management (IAM) services. Specific analysis efforts include but are not limited to the following:
Assist stakeholders in understanding IAM capabilities and functions.
Facilitate translation of business and operational needs from Member and Workforce channels and related stakeholders to improve existing capabilities and define new IAM transformational capabilities.
Support business and technical stakeholders in transitioning to new IAM capabilities and services across various IAM domains such as Access Management, Identity Lifecycle Management and Privileged Access Management.
Ensure IAM governance structures adhere to defined policies and standards. Ensure that IAM core capabilities, IAM operations, business stakeholder usage and application integrations follow the governance structures.
Maintain a continuous and strong security posture across all business and ISD IAM stakeholders via ongoing, proactive reviews of account access and authorization, and designing short- and long-term improvements to ensure violations are remediated.
Additional Responsibilities
Analyze information, requirements, data, work quality, work methods, processes, service specific practices, standards and metrics/statistics (Complex analysis).
Interpret results of analysis; present recommendations, including alternatives and implications (Significant Impact).
Collaborate with other business units to analyze and improve processing procedures and resolve problems (Significant impact).
Analyze changes in policies, procedures and products; determine the impact on the group functions (Complex analysis).
Identify and analyze opportunities for new and/or improved processes, data, or technology; provide clear picture of possible outcomes (Complex analysis).
Ensure clear, concise and effective communication of material (Leadership).
Work with peers, business units and/or project teams, and vendors to ensure business needs are fully communicated, documented and satisfied (Leadership).
Monitor and analyze key performance indicators, and establish processes and methodologies for preventative mitigation (Complex analysis).
Compile, review and prepare data to be used by analysts and management in the analysis of operations, services and products (Most complex/Unusual).
Conduct benchmarking, trend analysis and other input to drive continuous improvement and elevate service performance (Significant impact).
Analyze information to produce analytically-driven inferences and hypotheses to generate actionable recommendations (Complex analysis).
Solve business problems by defining the problem, interviewing stakeholders, identifying and evaluating alternatives, and presenting findings (Most complex/Unusual).
Provide input into best practices for the respective area (Leadership).
Provide regular feedback to employees and input to the PAR process
Ensure compliance with Navy Federal Credit Union ISD standards and best practices
Performs other related duties as assigned
Qualifications
8+ years of experience working with transformational initiatives in an IT environment
5+ Identity and Access Management function, preferably in a financial service organization
5+ years of experience leading an operational, governance, or business engagement function within an IAM organization
Desired - Specific experience leading the transition of business and operational applications to new IAM governance processes
Desired - Knowledge of Navy Federal business processes and applications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science or other related field, or the equivalent combination of education, training or experience
Expert skill maintaining accuracy with attention to detail and meeting deadlines
Extensive experience in IT solution creation and delivery with increased business intelligence
Expert research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Advanced organizational, planning and time management skills
Expert skill communicating with all levels within an organization and acting as a trusted liaison between IT delivery teams and front-office business units
Extensive experience in working and participating in cross-functional, multi-dimensional teams and projects
Advanced skill presenting findings, conclusions, alternatives, and information clearly and concisely
Advanced relationship building, negotiation and facilitation skills
Extensive experience in leading, guiding & mentoring others
Expert skill exercising initiative and using good judgment to make sound decisions
Advanced verbal and written communication skills
Expert skill analyzing and organizing problems or work processes for technical solutions
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Extensive experience in translating business requirements into technical solutions
Remains cognizant of and adheres to Navy Federal policies and procedures, and regulations pertaining to the Bank Secrecy Act.
Hours:
Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 4:30pm (Partial Telework Options Available)
Location:
820 Follin Lane, Vienna, VA 22180 | 5550 Heritage Oaks Dr Pensacola, FL 32526 | 141 Security Dr. Winchester, VA 22602
**Full remote is NOT considered at this time.
Navy Federal Credit Union assesses market data to establish salary ranges that enable us to remain
competitive. You are paid within the salary range, based on your experience, location and market position.
The salary range for this position is:
$92,900 to $160,400
Due to COVID-19 and social distancing, this position will be temporarily working from home with plans to return to campus at the desired location listed once Navy Federal is back to normal operations. The specific logistics for returning to campus will be determined at a future date by individual leadership.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Navy Federal values, celebrates, and enacts diversity in the workplace. Navy Federal takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans, recently separated veterans, and other protected veterans. EOE/AA/M/F/Veteran/Disability
COVID-19 Vaccine Information
As a COVID-19 safety measure, our employees must either provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination or follow additional safety protocols, including testing.
Disclaimer
Navy Federal reserves the right to fill this role at a higher/lower grade level based on business need. An assessment may be required to compete for this position.
Bank Secrecy Act
Remains cognizant of and adheres to Navy Federal policies and procedures, and regulations pertaining to the Bank Secrecy Act.
Employee Referrals

title: IDENTITY AND ACCESS MANAGEMENT ANALYST - California State University - Los Angeles, CA
description:
As part of our equity and diversity commitment and continuing effort to offer career ladder opportunities to our employees, the following position is being offered as a promotional recruitment effort. Only current state staff on-campus may apply.
Job No: 501712; 7/12/2021
IDENTITY AND ACCESS MANAGEMENT ANALYST
Analyst/Programmer- Career
Information Technology Services
Salary Range: $4,372 - $10,792/Monthly
Work Schedule: Full-Time, Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; Temporary one-year appointment from the date of hire; may be extended; may become permanent; nights and weekends may be required; exempt classification.
Essential Functions: Under the general direction of the assistant director of IT Infrastructure, the incumbent serves as an analyst for the Identity and Access Management (IAM) system, working to manage the development, project implementation, and maintenance of the ongoing operation and the system. The incumbent determines project and system requirements, prepares project plans, monitors project team tasks and activities, determines project priorities and ensures the project remains on schedule. The incumbent performs a variety of technical tasks including, but not limited to, solutions design, architecture, requirements gathering, product installation, configuration, tuning, development, testing, debugging, operations, analysis, and documentation. The incumbent works with the system architect, the manager of database technology, and the Security and Compliance unit to develop access and authentication models and resolve identified modeling and integration issues. In collaboration with the system architect, the incumbent develops, populates, documents, and maintains the campus enterprise directory, directory connectors, and account provisioning systems. Along with the security team, the incumbent helps establish data access security profiles, develops backup procedures and disaster recovery procedures for IAM applications, and maintains audit trails of security maintenance activity. The incumbent also writes user and technical support documentation for new and modified programs, production, and operations procedures. Works with the Server Team to develop functional and technical training materials; assists with the training of users on new systems and enhancements; helps with the cross-training of designated ITS staff to ensure full system coverage; maintains and modifies assigned applications and systems to ensure minimal loss of productivity and service. Develops backup procedures for data, applications, network servers; monitors physical performance of backups; works with the Server Team to ensure that all disaster recovery documentation for IAM systems is accurate and complete and updated immediately as system changes occur; participates in the ITS disaster recovery in the event of a catastrophic loss of campus systems, if assigned to do so; works with the ITS system architect to establish and maintain access security profiles as specified by the system/application owner; ensures campus access and authentication security standards, including individual access levels, backup and archival procedures, and detection are enforced; monitors enterprise directory disk space utilization and system performance; maintains documentation of release/level at which all IAM software is operated; performs the technical installation, testing and implementation of IAM systems; and performs the quality assurance review of system development plans and completed products to ensure system integrity.
Required Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor’s degree, or education and experience equivalent to graduation from a four-year accredited college or university, in Computer Science, Business Administration, Business Information Systems, or other computer or systems related field. Four years of progressively responsible system development/engineering experience performing design, analysis, development, implementation and maintenance of middleware systems, which includes at least two years of direct experience with the design and deployment of one or more Identity Management technologies and related protocols, with either a Microsoft deployment or other enterprise-level 10M system. The incumbent must also have working operational experience with the Microsoft Identity; at least one year of experience with either a Microsoft Active Directory, or operational experience in other enterprise-level IDM systems; working operational experience with the Microsoft Identity Management system (MIM); and experience interacting with Microsoft O365 cloud services, Azure Active Directory. The incumbent must have workstation productivity skills with Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, Outlook, Access, PowerPoint and SharePoint. The incumbent must have working knowledge of Secure Work monitoring system; of Java scripting and Oracle (SQL); state and federal laws and regulations affecting the handling, access, storage and disposal of Levels 1 and 2 confidential and personal data, and the ability to apply security guidelines into system design and operation; the principles of disaster recovery; Management system (MIM); and Java scripting and Oracle (SQL). The incumbent must have the ability to perform problem resolution, data gathering, analysis and design; communicate well both orally and written; prepare written documentation, including college-level writing and grammatical skills; develop technical design documents; assist with project management, including planning, development, installation, implementation, testing, upgrades and integration of system components; and have a demonstrated interest and/or ability to work in a multicultural/multiethnic environment. A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered.
Desired Qualifications: Experience with other programming languages (C/C++, XML, Java, .Net and ColdFusion); with MS Project, Visio, Microsoft PowerShell scripting, and Microsoft Identity Manager; in higher education or K-12; and with state or local governments. Knowledge of Red Hat Linux; cryptography (SSL, certificates) and TCP/IP networking; and Microsoft server platforms, 2012 R2, 2016, 2019. The ability to write UNIX scripts.
Closing Date: Revision of applications will begin on July 26, 2021 and will continue until the position is filled; however, the position may close when an adequate number of qualified applicants are received. A COMPLETED ON-LINE CAL STATE LA APPLICATION FOR EMPLOYMENT IS REQUIRED. RESUMES WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IN LIEU OF A COMPLETED APPLICATION.
